comment: I took her for MGT4003 and all I have to say is good luck. She's useless and her instructions are horrible and unclear. She also tried to make me feel back for asking her questions on several occasions. Pick the other prof for this class if you can, but his sections fill up fast. Just be prepared to be confused half the time.

She is definitely a professor I would pass on if I had an option. She provides ambiguous direction and is condescending when asked for clarity. She would rather blame the students for misunderstanding when it becomes clear that it is her lack of understanding of her own assignment instructions that presents the issue.

Very un-clear expectations for the group project in this class! Minimal instructions on how to complete assignments like the group project and is not very helpful over email to resolve issues. Find another prof!!!

Dr. Kim cares about her students! Read the text and study your notes for tests. Tests don't match the homework, so just get the homework done as quickly as possible and then focus on studying the text for exams. Project isn't bad, just time consuming; make sure you have a good group (I didn't, it was horrible). Not the worst option for this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects

comment: Quite possibly the worst professor at KSU. She is rude and unprofessional, exams do not match what is learned on homework and quizzes, and the grading policy for the group project is completely unfair. You are probably much better off taking this course with any other professor.
Horrible. Terrible. Agonizing. Genuinely the worst professor I have encountered in my entire educational career. DO. NOT. TAKE.

DO NOT TAKE. Professor Kim has no real world experience and it shows. Tests are nothing like quizzes/hw and she directly goes against her syllabus for some issues but not others. Responds to any concerns with "deal with it or drop the class." Insanely unprofessional and generally just embarrassing she got a teaching job. Any other teacher is better

Prof is passive aggressive in emails and test questions are not solved like hw/textbook. Grading is random and prof is fond of telling people to drop the class if they don't like it. She does keep to her schedule but I recommend avoiding if possible. 
Connect SB 10%
Connect Quizzes 10%
HW 25%
Practice Exams 10%
Exams 20%
Group Project 20%

This professor is abysmal.  Grading is inconsistent.  Has never worked in the real world, so doesn't understand what she's trying to teach.  Any interaction with her results in a bad attitude back and being told if you don't like it, drop the class.  0 help in learning.  DO NOT TAKE

The worst professor I have ever taken. When a completely valid concern is brought up, "figure it out or drop the class" is her answer. Uses Excel to teach course material and does not allow it to be used on the LockDown Browser tests. Completely ignores the information present in her own syllabus. Only 4yrs private sector experience ending in 2002.

DO NOT TAKE. The most unprofessional, rude, & careless teacher I have had in all my education. Responds to concerns and worries with, "figure it out or drop the class." Gives snarky responses, and goes directly against syllabus. Teaches using Excel, but tests you by hand with no instruction given on how to learn by hand and no Excel is allowed. 0/5

This professor does not respond to questions or concerns with any sense that she cares about her students AT ALL.  Probably the worst professor I've ever had.  The assignments are all on the McGraw-Hill Connect website; the questions are often worded in a way to make them "trick" questions. Take ANY other professor if you can.

I'm not sure why she's rated so low. I took this class over the summer, and it was really managable in comparison to my others. I was able to get a B with pretty standard effort. Just stay on top of your work and do any possible extra credit. She definitely cares about her students and wants them to succeed, but you do have to put in some work.

Dr. Kim is a very nice woman, but the class is not put together well, mostly because of technical issues and her. Online quizzes, tests, and homework math portions do not have any explanation for why the answer is what it is, and many times it has occurred where the answer is actually wrong, after talking to Dr. Kim about it. Do not take this class

I would strongly recommend not taking this professor. The test does not reflect homework and quizzes. It is almost a waste of time doing the extra credit, yes, it is explained out it works, however, chances you getting the extra credit is slim to none. The tests are open book but the book is online only and the tests on lockdown browser.

If you have another choice for this class take that one instead. Tests are in no way close to homework and quizzes, and are on lockdown browser when youre taught things in Excel then cant use it. Extra credit only counts if youre close to the next letter grade otherwise useless work.
Concepts are not hard but what we learn from homework and the practice exam, the tests do not match. good thing is weekly work outweighs tests
I would strongly suggest taking someone else unless you like to teach yourself. Even after studying, the tests are near impossible to pass and are usually 100+ questions.

Coming from a fairly good test taker, if you want a professor that makes tests nearly impossible to pass, then this is the one for you. The class average on our 2nd test was a 68 and she refused to even acknowledge it. I sunk hours into these tests for a class that's outside of my major, and I'm probably still not going to pass. Heed this warning!!
